Posts.Title: February 2011 Rads ToriGirl Elisimo

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2011 11:38AM mrsbeasley38 wrote: Hello everyone. I had two rads in January. And this is what I know after 6 treatments. I have felt some twinging in my chest area. not neccessarily my breast area.  but the techs forewarned me about this twinging feeling I may experience.  Seems to happen a couple of hours after treatment.  Maybe it is my body trying to clean itself up after the radiation influx.  My RO told me that he does not expect me to get tired.  I am thinking he is trying to keep me optimistic.  I have been working out and do feel like It gives me great stamina for all this. Keeps me healthier. I am prone to get pink and I know from being  a redhead that the whitest virgin skin burn will hurt like none other. Also I think the smaller the boob the better .....finally a good reason to have small ta ta's :) So far my only sympton was the first day after I felt like I was kinda gettin a virus ...maybe I was ......maybe it was my body fighting.off the rads....but after that I have felt great. My aerola  (sp) is tender already but no big deal.  I can just tell it is more sensitive than it was before.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Rads ToriGirl Elisimo

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 05:17PM mrsbeasley38 wrote: I sit at a desk mostly.  I do need to get up and around more 'cuz I do sit so much. I am sure I would be more tired without the excercise.  I found out yesterday that when my regular physician told me my iron was low in Sept it was not just low I was already anemic before any of my mammograms.  I was at a 5  last week for hemoglobin. aaahhh  no wonder I felt tired.  But obviously it has nothing to do with the rads
Posts.Title: February 2011 Rads ToriGirl Elisimo

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 10:48PM - edited Jan 26, 2011 10:49PM by mrsbeasley38 My thoughts are with you lots of positive thoughts your way.  My radiologist used the word "early" if it is positive.  Docs do not puff sunshine up your you know what.  hang on to that  He told me the truth.  he was right mine was so early the biopsy got it all and the lumpectomy showed none through out that I had after.
Posts.Title: i am soooo scared! tpetrone Sandeeonherown

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2011 07:58AM mrsbeasley38 wrote: The radiologist came in and told me that he saw two spots.  15% of these he can tell they are malignnant, 155 he can tell they are benign. 70% he cannot say.  but , he stated he was more concerned about on the spots than the other.  But he said do not start crying or freak out because even if it is, it is early. Turned out I had DCIS 98% curable.  I like the word early.
Posts.Title: How many of you were told.... BioAdoptMom3 marie5890

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2011 12:25AM mrsbeasley38 wrote: I had #22 today. Thank G it is Friday though.  I am seeing red and a little puffiness in an area beside my aerola.  Have not seen that before.  Not painful just annoying.  Using the "silvacream" at night , auqafor and aloe......  I understand with the boosts it will stop affecting my aerola. Maybe I should use some cold compresses too? I have had some sunburns in my day and this is not what I expected.  It is not warm and it does not burn. It just slowly turned red but I have had sunburns much more painful than this.

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2013 12:52PM mrsbeasley38 wrote: I had low grade DCIS , I was 44 at the time , not in menopause, healthy no other history of issues with cancer or my heart or lungs. I did have radiation and there are many links to articles on this website where you can compare benefit vs risk of treatment.
Posts.Title: anyone with low grade dcis not having radiation joe1234 ballet12

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2014 12:11PM mrsbeasley38 wrote: Waiting is the hardest part ........There is nothing wrong with following the advice of the person who is telling you to take charge. My doc was going to send me to a breast surgeon for a biopsy but after I did not get a call in a week I called the hospital that did my mammos and instead of going to a surgeon where they would have cut into me , I had the stereotatic biopsy at the hospital and they referred me to the breast clinic. BTW the surgeons office never did call me for an appointment. Everyone's experience is different and maybe 99 out of 100 people do their jobs but sometimes you are that one patient that got the scheduler on a bad day or something.
